rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system. For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment. Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances. The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegmentPhases
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The line segment phases which belong to the line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Clamp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The clamps connected to the line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Cut
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Cuts applied to the line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PerLengthImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Per-length impedance of this line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0ch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section. This value represents the full charging over the full length of the line.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0ch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence series resistance of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series resistance of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: shortCircuitEndTemperature
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum permitted temperature at the end of SC for the calculation of minimum short-circuit currents. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence series reactance of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series reactance of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegmentPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents a single wire of an alternating current line segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The line segment to which the phase belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The phase connection of the wire at both ends.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sequenceNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number designation for this line segment phase. Each line segment phase within a line segment should have a unique sequence number. This is useful for unbalanced modelling to bind the mathematical model (PhaseImpedanceData of PerLengthPhaseImpedance) with the connectivity model (this class) and the physical model (WirePosition) without tight coupling.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ActivePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Product of RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the in-phase component of the current.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ActivePowerPerFrequency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power variation with frequency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AngleDegrees
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Measurement of angle in degrees.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AngleRadians
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase angle in radians.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ApparentPower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Product of the RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the current.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AsynchronousMachine
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A rotating machine whose shaft rotates asynchronously with the electrical field. Also known as an induction machine with no external connection to the rotor windings, e.g. squirrel-cage induction machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: asynchronousMachineType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the type of Asynchronous Machine (motor or generator).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: converterFedDrive
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether the machine is a converter fed drive. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: efficiency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Efficiency of the asynchronous machine at nominal operation as a percentage. Indicator for converter drive motors. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: iaIrRatio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ratio of locked-rotor current to the rated current of the motor (Ia/Ir). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: nominalFrequency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Nameplate data indicates if the machine is 50 Hz or 60 Hz.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: nominalSpeed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Nameplate data. Depends on the slip and number of pole pairs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: polePairNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number of pole pairs of stator. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedMechanicalPower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rated mechanical power (Pr in IEC 60909-0). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reversible
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates for converter drive motors if the power can be reversible. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rr1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Damper 1 winding resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rr2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Damper 2 winding resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rxLockedRotorRatio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Locked rotor ratio (R/X). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: tpo
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transient rotor time constant (greater than tppo).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: tppo
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sub-transient rotor time constant (greater than 0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xlr1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Damper 1 winding leakage reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xlr2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Damper 2 winding leakage reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetizing reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transient reactance (unsaturated) (greater than or equal to xpp).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xpp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sub-transient reactance (unsaturated).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xs
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Synchronous reactance (greater than xp).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: AsynchronousMachineKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kind of Asynchronous Machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: generator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Asynchronous Machine is a generator.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: motor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Asynchronous Machine is a motor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Defines a system base voltage which is referenced.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnds
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer ends at the base voltage. This is essential for PU calculation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Breaker
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mechanical switching device capable of making, carrying, and breaking currents under normal circuit conditions and also making, carrying for a specified time, and breaking currents under specified abnormal circuit conditions e.g. those of short circuit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: inTransitTime
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The transition time from open to close.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BusbarSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation. Voltage measurements are typically obtained from voltage transformers that are connected to busbar sections. A bus bar section may have many physical terminals but for analysis is modelled with exactly one logical terminal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltageControlZone
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A VoltageControlZone is controlled by a designated BusbarSection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ipMax
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum allowable peak short-circuit current of busbar (Ipmax in IEC 60909-0). Mechanical limit of the busbar in the substation itself. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Clamp
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Clamp is a galvanic connection at a line segment where other equipment is connected. A Clamp does not cut the line segment. A Clamp is ConductingEquipment and has one Terminal with an associated ConnectivityNode. Any other ConductingEquipment can be connected to the Clamp ConnectivityNode.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The line segment to which the clamp is connected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lengthFromTerminal1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The length to the place where the clamp is located starting from side one of the line segment, i.e. the line segment terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CompositeSwitch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A model of a set of individual Switches normally enclosed within the same cabinet and possibly with interlocks that restrict the combination of switch positions. These are typically found in medium voltage distribution networks. A CompositeSwitch could represent a Ring-Main-Unit (RMU), or pad-mounted switchgear, with primitive internal devices such as an internal bus-bar plus 3 or 4 internal switches each of which may individually be open or closed. A CompositeSwitch and a set of contained Switches can also be used to represent a multi-position switch e.g. a switch that can connect a circuit to Ground, Open or Busbar.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Switches
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Switches contained in this Composite switch.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: compositeSwitchType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An alphanumeric code that can be used as a reference to extra information such as the description of the interlocking scheme if any.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Conductance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Factor by which voltage must be multiplied to give corresponding power lost from a circuit. Real part of admittance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductancePerLength
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Real part of admittance per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ConductingEquipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Conductor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: length
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Segment length for calculating line section capabilities.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Connector
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation and are modelled with a single logical terminal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CoolantType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Method of cooling a machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: air
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Air.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: hydrogenGas
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Hydrogen gas.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: water
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Water.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CurrentFlow
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electrical current with sign convention: positive flow is out of the conducting equipment into the connectivity node. Can be both AC and DC.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Curve
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A multi-purpose curve or functional relationship between an independent variable (X-axis) and dependent (Y-axis) variables.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Cut
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A cut separates a line segment into two parts. The cut appears as a switch inserted between these two parts and connects them together. As the cut is normally open there is no galvanic connection between the two line segment parts. But it is possible to close the cut to get galvanic connection. The cut terminals are oriented towards the line segment terminals with the same sequence number. Hence the cut terminal with sequence number equal to 1 is oriented to the line segment's terminal with sequence number equal to 1. The cut terminals also act as connection points for jumpers and other equipment, e.g. a mobile generator. To enable this, connectivity nodes are placed at the cut terminals. Once the connectivity nodes are in place any conducting equipment can be connected at them.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The line segment to which the cut is applied.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lengthFromTerminal1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The length to the place where the cut is located starting from side one of the cut line segment, i.e. the line segment Terminal with sequenceNumber equal to 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: DisconnectingCircuitBreaker
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A circuit breaking device including disconnecting function, eliminating the need for separate disconnectors.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Disconnector
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A manually operated or motor operated mechanical switching device used for changing the connections in a circuit, or for isolating a circuit or equipment from a source of power. It is required to open or close circuits when negligible current is broken or made.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EarthFaultCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conducting equipment used to represent a connection to ground which is typically used to compensate earth faults. An earth fault compensator device modelled with a single terminal implies a second terminal solidly connected to ground. If two terminals are modelled, the ground is not assumed and normal connection rules apply.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Nominal resistance of device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConsumer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Generic user of energy - a point of consumption on the power system model. EnergyConsumer.pfixed, .qfixed, .pfixedPct and .qfixedPct have meaning only if there is no LoadResponseCharacteristic associated with EnergyConsumer or if LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is set to False.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConsumerPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The individual phase models for this energy consumer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: customerCount
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number of individual customers represented by this demand.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: grounded
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: p
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pfixed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pfixedPct
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fixed active power as a percentage of load group fixed active power. Used to represent the time-varying components. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phaseConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: qfixed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: qfixedPct
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fixed reactive power as a percentage of load group fixed reactive power. Used to represent the time-varying components. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConsumerPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A single phase of an energy consumer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergyConsumer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The energy consumer to which this phase belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: p
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pfixed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pfixedPct
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fixed active power as per cent of load group fixed active power. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase of this energy consumer component. If the energy consumer is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point. If the energy consumer is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy consumer connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: qfixed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power of the load that is a fixed quantity. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: qfixedPct
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fixed reactive power as per cent of load group fixed reactive power. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergySchedulingType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Used to define the type of generation for scheduling purposes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergySource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy Source of a particular Energy Scheduling Type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergySource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution voltage level.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergySchedulingType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy Scheduling Type of an Energy Source.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergySourcePhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The individual phase information of the energy source.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: activePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: High voltage source active injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: nominalVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase-to-phase nominal voltage.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pMax
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This is the maximum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pMin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This is the minimum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence Thevenin resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence Thevenin resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reactivePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: High voltage source reactive injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Negative sequence Thevenin resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltageAngle
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase angle of a-phase open circuit used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltageMagnitude
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase-to-phase open circuit voltage magnitude used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence Thevenin reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence Thevenin reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Negative sequence Thevenin reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergySourcePhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents the single phase information of an unbalanced energy source.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EnergySource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The energy sourceto which the phase belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase of this energy source component. If the energy source wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point. If the energy source is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy source connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Equipment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanical.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: EquipmentContainer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A modelling construct to provide a root class for containing equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ExternalNetworkInjection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class represents the external network and it is used for IEC 60909 calculations.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: governorSCD
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power Frequency Bias. This is the change in power injection divided by the change in frequency and negated. A positive value of the power frequency bias provides additional power injection upon a drop in frequency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ikSecond
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik"). Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxInitialSymShCCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" max) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxP
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum active power of the injection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxQ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxR0ToX0Ratio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum ratio of zero sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its zero sequence reactance (R(0)/X(0) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxR1ToX1Ratio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxZ0ToZ1Ratio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) max). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minInitialSymShCCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum initial symmetrical short-circuit currents (Ik" min) in A (Ik" = Sk"/(SQRT(3) Un)). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minP
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum active power of the injection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minQ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum reactive power limit. It is used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange and not for short circuit modelling.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minR0ToX0Ratio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether initial symmetrical short-circuit current and power have been calculated according to IEC (Ik"). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 6090.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minR1ToX1Ratio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum ratio of positive sequence resistance of Network Feeder to its positive sequence reactance (R(1)/X(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minZ0ToZ1Ratio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum ratio of zero sequence impedance to its positive sequence impedance (Z(0)/Z(1) min). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: p
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for steady state solutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: referencePriority
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltageFactor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage factor in pu, which was used to calculate short-circuit current Ik" and power Sk". Used only if short circuit calculations are done according to superposition method.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Frequency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Cycles per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FrequencyConverter
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A device to convert from one frequency to another (e.g., frequency F1 to F2) comprises a pair of FrequencyConverter instances. One converts from F1 to DC, the other converts the DC to F2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: frequency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Frequency on the AC side.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxP
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum active power on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum voltage on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minP
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The minimum active power on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The minimum voltage on the DC side at which the frequency converter should operate.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Fuse
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An overcurrent protective device with a circuit opening fusible part that is heated and severed by the passage of overcurrent through it. A fuse is considered a switching device because it breaks current.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ground
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A point where the system is grounded used for connecting conducting equipment to ground. The power system model can have any number of grounds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GroundDisconnector
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A manually operated or motor operated mechanical switching device used for isolating a circuit or equipment from ground.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GroundingImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A fixed impedance device used for grounding.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactance of device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IdentifiedObject
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing identification and naming attributes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Jumper
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A short section of conductor with negligible impedance which can be manually removed and replaced if the circuit is de-energized. Note that zero-impedance branches can potentially be modelled by other equipment types.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Junction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A point where one or more conducting equipments are connected with zero resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Length
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Unit of length. It shall be a positive value or zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Line
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains equipment beyond a substation belonging to a power transmission line.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Region
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The sub-geographical region of the line.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LinearShuntCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A linear shunt compensator has banks or sections with equal admittance values.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0PerSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bPerSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0PerSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gPerSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LinearShuntCompensatorPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A per phase linear shunt compensator has banks or sections with equal admittance values.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bPerSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Susceptance per section of the phase if shunt compensator is wye connected. Susceptance per section phase to phase if shunt compensator is delta connected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gPerSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conductance per section for this phase if shunt compensator is wye connected. Conductance per section phase to phase if shunt compensator is delta connected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LoadBreakSwitch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mechanical switching device capable of making, carrying, and breaking currents under normal operating conditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: MutualCoupling
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This class represents the zero sequence line mutual coupling.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: First_Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The starting terminal for the calculation of distances along the first branch of the mutual coupling. Normally MutualCoupling would only be used for terminals of AC line segments. The first and second terminals of a mutual coupling should point to different AC line segments.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Second_Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The starting terminal for the calculation of distances along the second branch of the mutual coupling.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0ch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence mutual coupling shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: distance11
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Distance to the start of the coupled region from the first line's terminal having sequence number equal to 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: distance12
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Distance to the end of the coupled region from the first line's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: distance21
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Distance to the start of coupled region from the second line's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: distance22
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Distance to the end of coupled region from the second line's terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0ch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence mutual coupling shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence branch-to-branch mutual impedance coupling, resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence branch-to-branch mutual impedance coupling, reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NonlinearShuntCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A non linear shunt compensator has bank or section admittance values that differ. The attributes g, b, g0 and b0 of the associated NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint describe the total conductance and admittance of a NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint at a section number specified by NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint.sectionNumber.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A per phase non linear shunt compensator has bank or section admittance values that differ. The attributes g and b of the associated NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhasePoint describe the total conductance and admittance of a NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhasePoint at a section number specified by NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhasePoint.sectionNumber.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhasePoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A per phase non linear shunt compensator bank or section admittance value. The number of NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint instances associated with a NonlinearShuntCompensatorPhase shall be equal to ShuntCompensatorPhase.maximumSections. ShuntCompensator.sections shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint-s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sectionNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The number of the section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NonlinearShuntCompensatorPoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A non linear shunt compensator bank or section admittance value. The number of NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint instances associated with a NonlinearShuntCompensator shall be equal to ShuntCompensator.maximumSections. ShuntCompensator.sections shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint-s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance per section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sectionNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The number of the section.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Per Unit - a positive or negative value referred to a defined base. Values typically range from -10 to +10.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PerCent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Percentage on a defined base. For example, specify as 100 to indicate at the defined base.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Normally 0 to 100 on a defined base.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PerLengthImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Common type for per-length impedance electrical catalogues.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ACLineSegments
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All line segments described by this per-length impedance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PerLengthLineParameter
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Common type for per-length electrical catalogues describing line parameters.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PerLengthPhaseImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Impedance and admittance parameters per unit length for n-wire unbalanced lines, in matrix form.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseImpedanceData
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All data that belong to this conductor phase impedance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: conductorCount
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number of phase, neutral, and other wires retained. Constrains the number of matrix elements and the phase codes that can be used with this matrix.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PerLengthSequenceImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sequence impedance and admittance parameters per unit length, for transposed lines of 1, 2, or 3 phases. For 1-phase lines, define x=x0=xself. For 2-phase lines, define x=xs-xm and x0=xs+xm.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0ch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0ch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence shunt (charging) conductance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence series resistance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series resistance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence series reactance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series reactance, per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PetersenCoil
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A variable impedance device normally used to offset line charging during single line faults in an ungrounded section of network.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The mode of operation of the Petersen coil.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: nominalU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The nominal voltage for which the coil is designed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: offsetCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The offset current that the Petersen coil controller is operating from the resonant point. This is normally a fixed amount for which the controller is configured and could be positive or negative. Typically 0 to 60 A depending on voltage and resonance conditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: positionCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The control current used to control the Petersen coil also known as the position current. Typically in the range of 20 mA to 200 mA.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xGroundMax
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xGroundMin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The minimum reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xGroundNominal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The nominal reactance. This is the operating point (normally over compensation) that is defined based on the resonance point in the healthy network condition. The impedance is calculated based on nominal voltage divided by position current.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PetersenCoilModeKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The mode of operation for a Petersen coil.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: automaticPositioning
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Automatic positioning.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fixed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fixed position.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: manual
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Manual positioning.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseCode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An unordered enumeration of phase identifiers. Allows designation of phases for both transmission and distribution equipment, circuits and loads. The enumeration, by itself, does not describe how the phases are connected together or connected to ground. Ground is not explicitly denoted as a phase. Residential and small commercial loads are often served from single-phase, or split-phase, secondary circuits. For the example of s12N, phases 1 and 2 refer to hot wires that are 180 degrees out of phase, while N refers to the neutral wire. Through single-phase transformer connections, these secondary circuits may be served from one or two of the primary phases A, B, and C. For three-phase loads, use the A, B, C phase codes instead of s12N. The integer values are from IEC 61968-9 to support revenue metering applications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseImpedanceData
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Impedance and conductance matrix element values. The diagonal elements are described by the elements having the same toPhase and fromPhase value and the off diagonal elements have different toPhase and fromPhase values. The matrix can also be stored in symmetric lower triangular format using the row and column attributes, which map to ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conductor phase impedance to which this data belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Susceptance matrix element value, per length of unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: column
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The matrix element's column number, in the range 1 to row. Only the lower triangle needs to be stored. This column number matches ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: fromPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Refer to the class description.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conductance matrix element value, per length of unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance matrix element value, per length of unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: row
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The matrix elements row number, in the range 1 to PerLengthPhaseImpedance.conductorCount. Only the lower triangle needs to be stored. This row number matches ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: toPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Refer to the class description.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactance matrix element value, per length of unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseShuntConnectionKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The configuration of phase connections for a single terminal device such as a load or capacitor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: D
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Delta connection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: G
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ground connection; use when explicit connection to ground needs to be expressed in combination with the phase code, such as for electrical wire/cable or for meters.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: I
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Independent winding, for single-phase connections.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Y
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wye connection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Yn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wye, with neutral brought out for grounding.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A transformer phase shifting tap model that controls the phase angle difference across the power transformer and potentially the active power flow through the power transformer. This phase tap model may also impact the voltage magnitude.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer end to which this phase tap changer belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes the tap model for an asymmetrical phase shifting transformer in which the difference voltage vector adds to the in-phase winding. The out-of-phase winding is the transformer end where the tap changer is located. The angle between the in-phase and out-of-phase windings is named the winding connection angle. The phase shift depends on both the difference voltage magnitude and the winding connection angle.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: windingConnectionAngle
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The phase angle between the in-phase winding and the out-of -phase winding used for creating phase shift. The out-of-phase winding produces what is known as the difference voltage. Setting this angle to 90 degrees is not the same as a symmetrical transformer. The attribute can only be multiples of 30 degrees. The allowed range is -150 degrees to 150 degrees excluding 0.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerLinear
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes a tap changer with a linear relation between the tap step and the phase angle difference across the transformer. This is a mathematical model that is an approximation of a real phase tap changer. The phase angle is computed as stepPhaseShiftIncrement times the tap position. The voltage magnitude of both sides is the same.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: stepPhaseShiftIncrement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase shift per step position. A positive value indicates a positive angle variation from the Terminal at the PowerTransformerEnd, where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer. The actual phase shift increment might be more accurately computed from the symmetrical or asymmetrical models or a tap step table lookup if those are available.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xMax
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The maximum reactance (xMax) appears at the low and high tap positions. Depending on the u curve the attribute can be either higher or lower than PowerTransformerEnd.x.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xMin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The minimum reactance (xMin) appears at the mid tap position. PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be consistent with PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin and PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin. In case of inconsistency, PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be used.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerNonLinear
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The non-linear phase tap changer describes the non-linear behaviour of a phase tap changer. This is a base class for the symmetrical and asymmetrical phase tap changer models. The details of these models can be found in IEC 61970-301.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltageStepIncrement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The voltage step increment on the out of phase winding (the PowerTransformerEnd where the TapChanger is located) specified in percent of rated voltage of the PowerTransformerEnd. A positive value means a positive voltage variation from the Terminal at the PowerTransformerEnd, where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer. When the increment is negative, the voltage decreases when the tap step increases.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xMax
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The maximum reactance (xMax) appears at the low and high tap positions. Depending on the u curve the attribute can be either higher or lower than PowerTransformerEnd.x.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xMin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The reactance depend on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The minimum reactance (xMin) appear at the mid tap position. PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be consistent with PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin and PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin. In case of inconsistency, PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be used.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes a symmetrical phase shifting transformer tap model in which the voltage magnitude of both sides is the same. The difference voltage magnitude is the base in an equal-sided triangle where the sides corresponds to the primary and secondary voltages. The phase angle difference corresponds to the top angle and can be expressed as twice the arctangent of half the total difference voltage.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes a tabular curve for how the phase angle difference and impedance varies with the tap step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerTablePoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The points of this table.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerTabular
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The phase tap changers to which this phase tap table applies.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerTablePoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes each tap step in the phase tap changer tabular curve.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The table of this point.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: angle
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The angle difference in degrees. A positive value indicates a positive angle variation from the Terminal at the PowerTransformerEnd, where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerTabular
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes a tap changer with a table defining the relation between the tap step and the phase angle difference across the transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The phase tap changer table for this phase tap changer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Plant
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Plant is a collection of equipment for purposes of generation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerElectronicsConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A connection to the AC network for energy production or consumption that uses power electronics rather than rotating machines.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxIFault
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum fault current this device will contribute, in per-unit of rated current, before the converter protection will trip or bypass.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxQ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum reactive power limit. This is the maximum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minQ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum reactive power limit for the unit. This is the minimum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: p
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Equivalent resistance (RG) of generator. RG is considered for the calculation of all currents, except for the calculation of the peak current ip. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence resistance of the synchronous machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedS
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Nameplate apparent power rating for the unit. The attribute shall have a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rated voltage (nameplate data, Ur in IEC 60909-0). It is primarily used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909. The attribute shall be a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Negative sequence Thevenin resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence Thevenin reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence Thevenin reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Negative sequence Thevenin reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A single phase of a power electronics connection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerElectronicsConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power electronics connection of this power electronics connection phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: p
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow into the equipment from the network.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase of this energy producer component. If the energy producer is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point. If the energy producer is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy producer connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow into the equipment from the network.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerSystemResource
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A power system resource (PSR) can be an item of equipment such as a switch, an equipment container containing many individual items of equipment such as a substation, or an organisational entity such as sub-control area. Power system resources can have measurements associated.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An electrical device consisting of two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow). A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical. A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations. A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals. The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used. The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The ends of this power transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerTanks
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformers that belong to this bank.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The highest operating current (Ib in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit (depends on network configuration and relevant reliability philosophy). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The highest operating voltage (Ub in IEC 60909-0) before short circuit. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is worst case voltage on the low side winding (3.7.1 of IEC 60909:2001). Used to define operating conditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: beforeShortCircuitAnglePf
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The angle of power factor before short circuit (phib in IEC 60909-0). It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KT defined in IEC 60909-0. This is the worst case power factor. Used to define operating conditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: highSideMinOperatingU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The minimum operating voltage (uQmin in IEC 60909-0) at the high voltage side (Q side) of the unit transformer of the power station unit. A value well established from long-term operating experience of the system. It is used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KG defined in IEC 60909-0.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: isPartOfGeneratorUnit
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether the machine is part of a power station unit. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909. It has an impact on how the correction factors are calculated for transformers, since the transformer is not necessarily part of a synchronous machine and generating unit. It is not always possible to derive this information from the model. This is why the attribute is necessary.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: operationalValuesConsidered
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It is used to define if the data (other attributes related to short circuit data exchange) defines long term operational conditions or not. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vectorGroup
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Vector group of the transformer for protective relaying, e.g., Dyn1. For unbalanced transformers, this may not be simply determined from the constituent winding connections and phase angle displacements.
The vectorGroup string consists of the following components in the order listed: high voltage winding connection, mid voltage winding connection (for three winding transformers), phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11, low voltage winding connection phase displacement clock number from 0 to 11. The winding connections are D (delta), Y (wye), YN (wye with neutral), Z (zigzag), ZN (zigzag with neutral), A (auto transformer). Upper case means the high voltage, lower case mid or low. The high voltage winding always has clock position 0 and is not included in the vector group string. Some examples: YNy0 (two winding wye to wye with no phase displacement), YNd11 (two winding wye to delta with 330 degrees phase displacement), YNyn0d5 (three winding transformer wye with neutral high voltage, wye with neutral mid voltage and no phase displacement, delta low voltage with 150 degrees displacement).
Phase displacement is defined as the angular difference between the phasors representing the voltages between the neutral point (real or imaginary) and the corresponding terminals of two windings, a positive sequence voltage system being applied to the high-voltage terminals, following each other in alphabetical sequence if they are lettered, or in numerical sequence if they are numbered: the phasors are assumed to rotate in a counter-clockwise sense.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A PowerTransformerEnd is associated with each Terminal of a PowerTransformer. The impedance values r, r0, x, and x0 of a PowerTransformerEnd represents a star equivalent as follows. 1) for a two Terminal PowerTransformer the high voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=1) PowerTransformerEnd has non zero values on r, r0, x, and x0 while the low voltage (TransformerEnd.endNumber=2) PowerTransformerEnd has zero values for r, r0, x, and x0. Parameters are always provided, even if the PowerTransformerEnds have the same rated voltage. In this case, the parameters are provided at the PowerTransformerEnd which has TransformerEnd.endNumber equal to 1. 2) for a three Terminal PowerTransformer the three PowerTransformerEnds represent a star equivalent with each leg in the star represented by r, r0, x, and x0 values. 3) For a three Terminal transformer each PowerTransformerEnd shall have g, g0, b and b0 values corresponding to the no load losses distributed on the three PowerTransformerEnds. The total no load loss shunt impedances may also be placed at one of the PowerTransformerEnds, preferably the end numbered 1, having the shunt values on end 1. This is the preferred way. 4) for a PowerTransformer with more than three Terminals the PowerTransformerEnd impedance values cannot be used. Instead use the TransformerMeshImpedance or split the transformer into multiple PowerTransformers. Each PowerTransformerEnd must be contained by a PowerTransformer. Because a PowerTransformerEnd (or any other object) can not be contained by more than one parent, a PowerTransformerEnd can not have an association to an EquipmentContainer (Substation, VoltageLevel, etc).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The power transformer of this power transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetizing branch susceptance (B mag). The value can be positive or negative.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence magnetizing branch susceptance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: connectionKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kind of connection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetizing branch conductance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence magnetizing branch conductance (star-model).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phaseAngleClock
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Terminal voltage phase angle displacement where 360 degrees are represented with clock hours. The valid values are 0 to 11. For example, for the secondary side end of a transformer with vector group code of 'Dyn11', specify the connection kind as wye with neutral and specify the phase angle of the clock as 11. The clock value of the transformer end number specified as 1, is assumed to be zero. Note the transformer end number is not assumed to be the same as the terminal sequence number.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance (star-model) of the transformer end. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than zero for non-equivalent transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series resistance (star-model) of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedS
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Normal apparent power rating. The attribute shall be a positive value. For a two-winding transformer the values for the high and low voltage sides shall be identical.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rated voltage: phase-phase for three-phase windings, and either phase-phase or phase-neutral for single-phase windings. A high voltage side, as given by TransformerEnd.endNumber, shall have a ratedU that is greater than or equal to ratedU for the lower voltage sides. The attribute shall be a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence series reactance (star-model) of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Pressure
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure in pascals.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ProtectedSwitch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A ProtectedSwitch is a switching device that can be operated by ProtectionEquipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: breakingCapacity
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum fault current a breaking device can break safely under prescribed conditions of use.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A tap changer that changes the voltage ratio impacting the voltage magnitude but not the phase angle across the transformer.
Angle sign convention (general): Positive value indicates a positive phase shift from the winding where the tap is located to the other winding (for a two-winding transformer).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap ratio table for this ratio tap changer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer end to which this ratio tap changer belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: stepVoltageIncrement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tap step increment, in per cent of rated voltage of the power transformer end, per step position. When the increment is negative, the voltage decreases when the tap step increases.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: tculControlMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the regulation control mode (voltage or reactive) of the RatioTapChanger.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes a curve for how the voltage magnitude and impedance varies with the tap step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The ratio tap changer of this tap ratio table.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChangerTablePoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Points of this table.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChangerTablePoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes each tap step in the ratio tap changer tabular curve.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChangerTable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Table of this point.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Reactance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactance (imaginary part of impedance), at rated frequency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ReactancePerLength
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactance (imaginary part of impedance) per unit of length, at rated frequency.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ReactiveCapabilityCurve
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power rating envelope versus the synchronous machine's active power, in both the generating and motoring modes. For each active power value there is a corresponding high and low reactive power limit value. Typically there will be a separate curve for each coolant condition, such as hydrogen pressure. The Y1 axis values represent reactive minimum and the Y2 axis values represent reactive maximum.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SynchronousMachines
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Synchronous machines using this curve.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: coolantTemperature
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The machine's coolant temperature (e.g., ambient air or stator circulating water).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: hydrogenPressure
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The hydrogen coolant pressure.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ReactivePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Product of RMS value of the voltage and the RMS value of the quadrature component of the current.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Recloser
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pole-mounted fault interrupter with built-in phase and ground relays, current transformer (CT), and supplemental controls.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulatingCondEq
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A type of conducting equipment that can regulate a quantity (i.e. voltage or flow) at a specific point in the network.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulatingControl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The regulating control scheme in which this equipment participates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: controlEnabled
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the regulation status of the equipment. True is regulating, false is not regulating.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulatingControl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies a set of equipment that works together to control a power system quantity such as voltage or flow. Remote bus voltage control is possible by specifying the controlled terminal located at some place remote from the controlling equipment. The specified terminal shall be associated with the connectivity node of the controlled point. The most specific subtype of RegulatingControl shall be used in case such equipment participate in the control, e.g. TapChangerControl for tap changers. For flow control, load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment. The attribute minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue are required in the following cases: - For a power generating module operated in power factor control mode to specify maximum and minimum power factor values; - Whenever it is necessary to have an off center target voltage for the tap changer regulator. For instance, due to long cables to off shore wind farms and the need to have a simpler setup at the off shore transformer platform, the voltage is controlled from the land at the connection point for the off shore wind farm. Since there usually is a voltage rise along the cable, there is typical and overvoltage of up 3-4 kV compared to the on shore station. Thus in normal operation the tap changer on the on shore station is operated with a target set point, which is in the lower parts of the dead band. The attributes minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue are not related to the attribute targetDeadband and thus they are not treated as an alternative of the targetDeadband. They are needed due to limitations in the local substation controller. The attribute targetDeadband is used to prevent the power flow from move the tap position in circles (hunting) that is to be used regardless of the attributes minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulatingCondEq
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The equipment that participates in this regulating control scheme.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulationSchedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Schedule for this regulating control.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The terminal associated with this regulating control. The terminal is associated instead of a node, since the terminal could connect into either a topological node or a connectivity node. Sometimes it is useful to model regulation at a terminal of a bus bar object.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: discrete
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The regulation is performed in a discrete mode. This applies to equipment with discrete controls, e.g. tap changers and shunt compensators.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: enabled
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The flag tells if regulation is enabled.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxAllowedTargetValue
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum allowed target value (RegulatingControl.targetValue).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minAllowedTargetValue
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum allowed target value (RegulatingControl.targetValue).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The regulating control mode presently available. This specification allows for determining the kind of regulation without need for obtaining the units from a schedule.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: monitoredPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase voltage controlling this regulator, measured at regulator location.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: targetDeadband
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This is a deadband used with discrete control to avoid excessive update of controls like tap changers and shunt compensator banks while regulating. The units of those appropriate for the mode. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. If RegulatingControl.discrete is set to "false", the RegulatingControl.targetDeadband is to be ignored. Note that for instance, if the targetValue is 100 kV and the targetDeadband is 2 kV the range is from 99 to 101 kV.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: targetValue
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The target value specified for case input. This value can be used for the target value without the use of schedules. The value has the units appropriate to the mode attribute.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: targetValueUnitMultiplier
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specify the multiplier for used for the targetValue.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulatingControlModeKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The kind of regulation model. For example regulating voltage, reactive power, active power, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: activePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power is specified.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: admittance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Admittance is specified.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: currentFlow
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Current flow is specified.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: powerFactor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor is specified.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reactivePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power is specified.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: temperature
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Control switches on/off based on the local temperature (i.e., a thermostat).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: timeScheduled
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Control switches on/off by time of day. The times may change on the weekend, or in different seasons.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage is specified.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulationSchedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A pre-established pattern over time for a controlled variable, e.g., busbar voltage.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulatingControl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Regulating controls that have this schedule.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltageControlZones
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A VoltageControlZone may have a voltage regulation schedule.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Resistance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance (real part of impedance).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ResistancePerLength
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance (real part of impedance) per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RotatingMachine
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A rotating machine which may be used as a generator or motor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: p
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedPowerFactor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor (nameplate data). It is primarily used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909. The attribute cannot be a negative value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedS
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Nameplate apparent power rating for the unit. The attribute shall have a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rated voltage (nameplate data, Ur in IEC 60909-0). It is primarily used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909. The attribute shall be a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RotationSpeed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number of revolutions per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SVCControlMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Static VAr Compensator control mode.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reactivePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power control.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage control.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SeasonDayTypeSchedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A time schedule covering a 24 hour period, with curve data for a specific type of season and day.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Seconds
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time, in seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time, in seconds

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sectionaliser
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Automatic switch that will lock open to isolate a faulted section. It may, or may not, have load breaking capability. Its primary purpose is to provide fault sectionalising at locations where the fault current is either too high, or too low, for proper coordination of fuses.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SeriesCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance. It is a two terminal device.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: varistorPresent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describe if a metal oxide varistor (mov) for over voltage protection is configured in parallel with the series compensator. It is used for short circuit calculations.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: varistorRatedCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum current the varistor is designed to handle at specified duration. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true. The attribute shall be a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: varistorVoltageThreshold
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The dc voltage at which the varistor starts conducting. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ShortCircuitRotorKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Type of rotor, used by short circuit applications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: salientPole1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Salient pole 1 in IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: salientPole2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Salient pole 2 in IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: turboSeries1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Turbo Series 1 in IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: turboSeries2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Turbo series 2 in IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ShuntCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A shunt capacitor or reactor or switchable bank of shunt capacitors or reactors. A section of a shunt compensator is an individual capacitor or reactor. A negative value for bPerSection indicates that the compensator is a reactor. ShuntCompensator is a single terminal device. Ground is implied.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ShuntCompensatorPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The individual phases models for the shunt compensator.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: aVRDelay
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An automatic voltage regulation delay (AVRDelay) which is the time delay from a change in voltage to when the capacitor is allowed to change state. This filters out temporary changes in voltage.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: grounded
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maximumSections
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum number of sections that may be switched in.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: nomU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The voltage at which the nominal reactive power may be calculated. This should normally be within 10% of the voltage at which the capacitor is connected to the network.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normalSections
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The normal number of sections switched in. The value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections.
