rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phaseConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The type of phase connection, such as wye or delta.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sections
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input. For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensator.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values. For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPoint-s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: switchOnCount
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The switch on count since the capacitor count was last reset or initialized.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: switchOnDate
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The date and time when the capacitor bank was last switched on.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltageSensitivity
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage sensitivity required for the device to regulate the bus voltage, in voltage/reactive power.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ShuntCompensatorPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Single phase of a multi-phase shunt compensator when its attributes might be different per phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ShuntCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Shunt compensator of this shunt compensator phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maximumSections
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum number of sections that may be switched in for this phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normalSections
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: For the capacitor phase, the normal number of sections switched in. The value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensatorPhase.maximumSections.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase of this shunt compensator component. If the shunt compensator is wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point. If the shunt compensator is delta connected, the phase indicates a shunt compensator connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sections
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Shunt compensator sections in use. Starting value for steady state solution. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete shunt compensators has yet been designed, a solutions where a narrow voltage band force the sections to oscillate or accommodate for a continuous solution as input. For LinearShuntConpensator the value shall be between zero and ShuntCompensatorPhase.maximumSections. At value zero the shunt compensator conductance and admittance is zero. Linear interpolation of conductance and admittance between the previous and next integer section is applied in case of non-integer values. For NonlinearShuntCompensator-s shall only be set to one of the NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint.sectionNumber. There is no interpolation between NonlinearShuntCompenstorPhasePoint-s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SinglePhaseKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Enumeration of single phase identifiers. Allows designation of single phases for both transmission and distribution equipment, circuits and loads.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase A.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: B
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase B.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: C
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase C.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: N
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phase 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Secondary phase 2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: StaticVarCompensator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A facility for providing variable and controllable shunt reactive power. The SVC typically consists of a stepdown transformer, filter, thyristor-controlled reactor, and thyristor-switched capacitor arms.
The SVC may operate in fixed MVar output mode or in voltage control mode. When in voltage control mode, the output of the SVC will be proportional to the deviation of voltage at the controlled bus from the voltage setpoint. The SVC characteristic slope defines the proportion. If the voltage at the controlled bus is equal to the voltage setpoint, the SVC MVar output is zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: capacitiveRating
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Capacitive reactance at maximum capacitive reactive power. Shall always be positive.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: inductiveRating
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Inductive reactance at maximum inductive reactive power. Shall always be negative.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node. Starting value for a steady state solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sVCControlMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: SVC control mode.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: slope
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The characteristics slope of an SVC defines how the reactive power output changes in proportion to the difference between the regulated bus voltage and the voltage setpoint. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltageSetPoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The reactive power output of the SVC is proportional to the difference between the voltage at the regulated bus and the voltage setpoint. When the regulated bus voltage is equal to the voltage setpoint, the reactive power output is zero.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SubGeographicalRegion
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A subset of a geographical region of a power system network model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Lines
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The lines within the sub-geographical region.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Susceptance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Imaginary part of admittance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SusceptancePerLength
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Imaginary part of admittance per unit of length.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Switch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits. All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches. The ACDCTerminal.connected at the two sides of the switch shall not be considered for assessing switch connectivity, i.e. only Switch.open, .normalOpen and .locked are relevant.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CompositeSwitch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Composite switch to which this Switch belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: locked
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
If true, the switch is locked. The resulting switch state is a combination of locked and Switch.open attributes as follows:
  • locked=true and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open and locked;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;
  • locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normalOpen
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The attribute is used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the Switch has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with the Switch.normalOpen.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: open
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The attribute tells if the switch is considered open when used as input to topology processing.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum continuous current carrying capacity in amps governed by the device material and construction. The attribute shall be a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: retained
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Branch is retained in the topological solution. The flow through retained switches will normally be calculated in power flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: switchOnCount
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The switch on count since the switch was last reset or initialized.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: switchOnDate
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The date and time when the switch was last switched on.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SwitchPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Single phase of a multi-phase switch when its attributes might be different per phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Switch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The switch of the switch phase.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: closed
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The attribute tells if the switch is considered closed when used as input to topology processing.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normalOpen
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the SwitchPhase has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with this value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phaseSide1
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase of this SwitchPhase on the side with terminal sequence number equal to 1. Should be a phase contained in that terminals phases attribute.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phaseSide2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase of this SwitchPhase on the side with terminal sequence number equal to 2. Should be a phase contained in that terminals Terminal.phases attribute.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratedCurrent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The maximum continuous current carrying capacity in amps governed by the device material and construction. The attribute shall be a positive value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SwitchSchedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A schedule of switch positions. If RegularTimePoint.value1 is 0, the switch is open. If 1, the switch is closed.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Switch
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A SwitchSchedule is associated with a Switch.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SynchronousMachine
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An electromechanical device that operates with shaft rotating synchronously with the network. It is a single machine operating either as a generator or synchronous condenser or pump.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: InitialReactiveCapabilityCurve
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The default reactive capability curve for use by a synchronous machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ReactiveCapabilityCurves
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All available reactive capability curves for this synchronous machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: aVRToManualLag
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time delay required when switching from Automatic Voltage Regulation (AVR) to Manual for a lagging MVAr violation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: aVRToManualLead
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time delay required when switching from Automatic Voltage Regulation (AVR) to Manual for a leading MVAr violation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: baseQ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Default base reactive power value. This value represents the initial reactive power that can be used by any application function.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: condenserP
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power consumed when in condenser mode operation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: coolantCondition
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Temperature or pressure of coolant medium.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: coolantType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Method of cooling the machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: earthing
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates whether or not the generator is earthed. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: earthingStarPointR
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Generator star point earthing resistance (Re). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: earthingStarPointX
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Generator star point earthing reactance (Xe). Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ikk
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Steady-state short-circuit current (in A for the profile) of generator with compound excitation during 3-phase short circuit. - Ikk=0: Generator with no compound excitation. - Ikk<>0: Generator with compound excitation. Ikk is used to calculate the minimum steady-state short-circuit current for generators with compound excitation. (4.6.1.2 in IEC 60909-0:2001). Used only for single fed short circuit on a generator. (4.3.4.2. in IEC 60909-0:2001).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: manualToAVR
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time delay required when switching from Manual to Automatic Voltage Regulation. This value is used in the accelerating power reference frame for powerflow solutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxQ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum reactive power limit. This is the maximum (nameplate) limit for the unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: maxU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum voltage limit for the unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minQ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum reactive power limit for the unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: minU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Minimum voltage limit for the unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mu
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Factor to calculate the breaking current (Section 4.5.2.1 in IEC 60909-0). Used only for single fed short circuit on a generator (Section 4.3.4.2. in IEC 60909-0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: operatingMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Current mode of operation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: qPercent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Part of the coordinated reactive control that comes from this machine. The attribute is used as a participation factor not necessarily summing up to 100% for the participating devices in the control.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Equivalent resistance (RG) of generator. RG is considered for the calculation of all currents, except for the calculation of the peak current ip. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence resistance of the synchronous machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Negative sequence resistance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: referencePriority
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Priority of unit for use as powerflow voltage phase angle reference bus selection. 0 = don t care (default) 1 = highest priority. 2 is less than 1 and so on.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: satDirectSubtransX
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Direct-axis subtransient reactance saturated, also known as Xd"sat.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: satDirectSyncX
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Direct-axes saturated synchronous reactance (xdsat); reciprocal of short-circuit ration. Used for short circuit data exchange, only for single fed short circuit on a generator. (4.3.4.2. in IEC 60909-0:2001).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: satDirectTransX
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Saturated Direct-axis transient reactance. The attribute is primarily used for short circuit calculations according to ANSI.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: shortCircuitRotorType
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Type of rotor, used by short circuit applications, only for single fed short circuit according to IEC 60909.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Modes that this synchronous machine can operate in.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: voltageRegulationRange
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Range of generator voltage regulation (PG in IEC 60909-0) used for calculation of the impedance correction factor KG defined in IEC 60909-0. This attribute is used to describe the operating voltage of the generating unit.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence reactance of the synchronous machine.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Negative sequence reactance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SynchronousMachineKind
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Synchronous machine type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: condenser
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a condenser.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: generator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: generatorOrCondenser
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator or as a condenser.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: generatorOrCondenserOrMotor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator or as a condenser or as a motor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: generatorOrMotor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a generator or as a motor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: motor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a motor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: motorOrCondenser
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates the synchronous machine can operate as a motor or as a condenser.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SynchronousMachineOperatingMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Synchronous machine operating mode.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: condenser
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operating as condenser.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: generator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operating as generator.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: motor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Operating as motor.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mechanism for changing transformer winding tap positions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChangerControl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The regulating control scheme in which this tap changer participates.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapSchedules
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A TapChanger can have TapSchedules.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: controlEnabled
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies the regulation status of the equipment. True is regulating, false is not regulating.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: highStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Highest possible tap step position, advance from neutral. The attribute shall be greater than lowStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: initialDelay
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: For an LTC, the delay for initial tap changer operation (first step change).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lowStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Lowest possible tap step position, retard from neutral.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ltcFlag
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specifies whether or not a TapChanger has load tap changing capabilities.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: neutralStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The neutral tap step position for this winding. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal or less than highStep. It is the step position where the voltage is neutralU when the other terminals of the transformer are at the ratedU. If there are other tap changers on the transformer those taps are kept constant at their neutralStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: neutralU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage at which the winding operates at the neutral tap setting. It is the voltage at the terminal of the PowerTransformerEnd associated with the tap changer when all tap changers on the transformer are at their neutralStep position. Normally neutralU of the tap changer is the same as ratedU of the PowerTransformerEnd, but it can differ in special cases such as when the tapping mechanism is separate from the winding more common on lower voltage transformers. This attribute is not relevant for PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical, PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical and PhaseTapChangerLinear.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normalStep
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap step position used in "normal" network operation for this winding. For a "Fixed" tap changer indicates the current physical tap setting. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: step
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Tap changer position. Starting step for a steady state solution. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous tap variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete tap changer has yet been designed, a solution where a narrow voltage band forces the tap step to oscillate or to accommodate for a continuous solution as input. The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: subsequentDelay
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: For an LTC, the delay for subsequent tap changer operation (second and later step changes).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChangerControl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes behaviour specific to tap changers, e.g. how the voltage at the end of a line varies with the load level and compensation of the voltage drop by tap adjustment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap changers that participates in this regulating tap control scheme.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: limitVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Maximum allowed regulated voltage on the PT secondary, regardless of line drop compensation. Sometimes referred to as first-house protection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lineDropCompensation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: If true, the line drop compensation is to be applied.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lineDropR
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Line drop compensator resistance setting for normal (forward) power flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lineDropX
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Line drop compensator reactance setting for normal (forward) power flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reverseLineDropR
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Line drop compensator resistance setting for reverse power flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reverseLineDropX
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Line drop compensator reactance setting for reverse power flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChangerTablePoint
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes each tap step in the tabular curve.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The magnetizing branch susceptance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual susceptance is calculated as follows: calculated magnetizing susceptance = b(nominal) * (1 + b(from this class)/100). The b(nominal) is defined as the static magnetizing susceptance on the associated power transformer end or ends. This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The magnetizing branch conductance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual conductance is calculated as follows: calculated magnetizing conductance = g(nominal) * (1 + g(from this class)/100). The g(nominal) is defined as the static magnetizing conductance on the associated power transformer end or ends. This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The resistance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual reactance is calculated as follows: calculated resistance = r(nominal) * (1 + r(from this class)/100). The r(nominal) is defined as the static resistance on the associated power transformer end or ends. This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ratio
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The voltage at the tap step divided by rated voltage of the transformer end having the tap changer. Hence this is a value close to one. For example, if the ratio at step 1 is 1.01, and the rated voltage of the transformer end is 110kV, then the voltage obtained by setting the tap changer to step 1 to is 111.1kV.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: step
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The tap step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The series reactance deviation as a percentage of nominal value. The actual reactance is calculated as follows: calculated reactance = x(nominal) * (1 + x(from this class)/100). The x(nominal) is defined as the static series reactance on the associated power transformer end or ends. This model assumes the star impedance (pi model) form.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapSchedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A pre-established pattern over time for a tap step.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A TapSchedule is associated with a TapChanger.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Temperature
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Value of temperature in degrees Celsius.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HasFirstMutualCoupling
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mutual couplings associated with the branch as the first branch.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HasSecondMutualCoupling
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mutual couplings with the branch associated as the first branch.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends connected at this terminal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerControlMode
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Control modes for a transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reactive
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power flow control.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: volt
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage control.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerCoreAdmittance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The transformer core admittance. Used to specify the core admittance of a transformer in a manner that can be shared among power transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends having this core admittance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetizing branch susceptance (B mag). The value can be positive or negative.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: b0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence magnetizing branch susceptance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetizing branch conductance (G mag).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: g0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence magnetizing branch conductance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A conducting connection point of a power transformer. It corresponds to a physical transformer winding terminal. In earlier CIM versions, the TransformerWinding class served a similar purpose, but this class is more flexible because it associates to terminal but is not a specialization of ConductingEquipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BaseVoltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Base voltage of the transformer end. This is essential for PU calculation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CoreAdmittance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Core admittance of this transformer end, representing magnetising current and core losses. The full values of the transformer should be supplied for one transformer end only.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FromMeshImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All mesh impedances between this 'to' and other 'from' transformer ends.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PhaseTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Phase tap changer associated with this transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RatioTapChanger
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ratio tap changer associated with this transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: StarImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (accurate for 2- or 3-winding transformers only) Pi-model impedances of this transformer end. By convention, for a two winding transformer, the full values of the transformer should be entered on the high voltage end (endNumber=1).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Terminal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Terminal of the power transformer to which this transformer end belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ToMeshImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All mesh impedances between this 'from' and other 'to' transformer ends.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bmagSat
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Core shunt magnetizing susceptance in the saturation region.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: endNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number for this transformer end, corresponding to the end's order in the power transformer vector group or phase angle clock number. Highest voltage winding should be 1. Each end within a power transformer should have a unique subsequent end number. Note the transformer end number need not match the terminal sequence number.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: grounded
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (for Yn and Zn connections) True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magBaseU
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The reference voltage at which the magnetizing saturation measurements were made.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magSatFlux
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Core magnetizing saturation curve knee flux level.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rground
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (for Yn and Zn connections) Resistance part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: xground
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: (for Yn and Zn connections) Reactive part of neutral impedance where 'grounded' is true.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerMeshImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer mesh impedance (Delta-model) between transformer ends. The typical case is that this class describes the impedance between two transformer ends pair-wise, i.e. the cardinalities at both transformer end associations are 1. However, in cases where two or more transformer ends are modelled the cardinalities are larger than 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FromTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: From end this mesh impedance is connected to. It determines the voltage reference.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ToTransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends this mesh impedance is connected to.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero-sequence resistance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero-sequence reactance between the 'from' and the 'to' end, seen from the 'from' end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerStarImpedance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer star impedance (Pi-model) that accurately reflects impedance for transformers with 2 or 3 windings. For transformers with 4 or more windings, TransformerMeshImpedance class shall be used. For transmission networks use PowerTransformerEnd impedances (r, r0, x, x0, b, b0, g and g0).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All transformer ends having this star impedance.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistance of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: r0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series resistance of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Positive sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: x0
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zero sequence series reactance of the transformer end.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerTank
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PowerTransformer
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Bank this transformer belongs to.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerTankEnds
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: All windings of this transformer.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerTankEnd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer tank end represents an individual winding for unbalanced models or for transformer tanks connected into a bank (and bank is modelled with the PowerTransformer).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TransformerTank
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Transformer this winding belongs to.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phases
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes the phases carried by a conducting equipment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: UnitMultiplier
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
The unit multipliers defined for the CIM. When applied to unit symbols, the unit symbol is treated as a derived unit. Regardless of the contents of the unit symbol text, the unit symbol shall be treated as if it were a single-character unit symbol. Unit symbols should not contain multipliers, and it should be left to the multiplier to define the multiple for an entire data type.
For example, if a unit symbol is "m2Pers" and the multiplier is "k", then the value is k(m**2/s), and the multiplier applies to the entire final value, not to any individual part of the value. This can be conceptualized by substituting a derived unit symbol for the unit type. If one imagines that the symbol "" represents the derived unit "m2Pers", then applying the multiplier "k" can be conceptualized simply as "k".
For example, the SI unit for mass is "kg" and not "g". If the unit symbol is defined as "kg", then the multiplier is applied to "kg" as a whole and does not replace the "k" in front of the "g". In this case, the multiplier of "m" would be used with the unit symbol of "kg" to represent one gram. As a text string, this violates the instructions in IEC 80000-1. However, because the unit symbol in CIM is treated as a derived unit instead of as an SI unit, it makes more sense to conceptualize the "kg" as if it were replaced by one of the proposed replacements for the SI mass symbol. If one imagines that the "kg" were replaced by a symbol "", then it is easier to conceptualize the multiplier "m" as creating the proper unit "m", and not the forbidden unit "mkg".

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: G
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Giga 10**9.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: M
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mega 10**6.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Y
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Yotta 10**24.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Z
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Zetta 10**21.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: c
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Centi 10**-2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: da
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Deca 10**1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Hecto 10**2.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: k
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Kilo 10**3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Milli 10**-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: micro
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Micro 10**-6.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: none
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: No multiplier or equivalently multiply by 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: UnitSymbol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The derived units defined for usage in the CIM. In some cases, the derived unit is equal to an SI unit. Whenever possible, the standard derived symbol is used instead of the formula for the derived unit. For example, the unit symbol Farad is defined as "F" instead of "CPerV". In cases where a standard symbol does not exist for a derived unit, the formula for the unit is used as the unit symbol. For example, density does not have a standard symbol and so it is represented as "kgPerm3". With the exception of the "kg", which is an SI unit, the unit symbols do not contain multipliers and therefore represent the base derived unit to which a multiplier can be applied as a whole. Every unit symbol is treated as an unparseable text as if it were a single-letter symbol. The meaning of each unit symbol is defined by the accompanying descriptive text and not by the text contents of the unit symbol. To allow the widest possible range of serializations without requiring special character handling, several substitutions are made which deviate from the format described in IEC 80000-1. The division symbol "/" is replaced by the letters "Per". Exponents are written in plain text after the unit as "m3" instead of being formatted as "m" with a superscript of 3 or introducing a symbol as in "m^3". The degree symbol "" is replaced with the letters "deg". Any clarification of the meaning for a substitution is included in the description for the unit symbol. Non-SI units are included in list of unit symbols to allow sources of data to be correctly labelled with their non-SI units (for example, a GPS sensor that is reporting numbers that represent feet instead of meters). This allows software to use the unit symbol information correctly convert and scale the raw data of those sources into SI-based units. The integer values are used for harmonization with IEC 61850.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Current in amperes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amperes squared (A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A2h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere-squared hour, ampere-squared hour.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A2s
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere squared time in square amperes (As).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: APerA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Current, ratio of amperages. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mA/A.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: APerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A/m, magnetic field strength, amperes per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ah
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere-hours, ampere-hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: As
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ampere seconds (As).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Bq
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Radioactivity in becquerels (1/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Btu
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy, British Thermal Units.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: C
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric charge in coulombs (As).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CPerkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Exposure (x rays), coulombs per kilogram.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CPerm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Surface charge density, coulombs per square metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: CPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric charge density, coulombs per cubic metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: F
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric capacitance in farads (C/V).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: FPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Permittivity, farads per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: G
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux density, gausses (1 G = 10-4 T).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Gy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Absorbed dose in grays (J/kg).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: GyPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Absorbed dose rate, grays per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: H
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric inductance in henrys (Wb/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Permeability, henrys per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Hz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Frequency in hertz (1/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HzPerHz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Frequency, rate of frequency change. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mHz/Hz.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: HzPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rate of change of frequency in hertz per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: J
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy in joules (Nm = CV = Ws).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Heat capacity in joules/kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specific energy, Joules / kg.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerkgK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specific heat capacity, specific entropy, joules per kilogram Kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Insulation energy density, joules per square metre or watt second per square metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy density, joules per cubic metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPermol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Molar energy, joules per mole.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPermolK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Molar entropy, molar heat capacity, joules per mole kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: JPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy rate in joules per second (J/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: K
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Temperature in kelvins.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: KPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Temperature change rate in kelvins per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: M
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Length, nautical miles (1 M = 1852 m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Mx
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux, maxwells (1 Mx = 10-8 Wb).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: N
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Force in newtons (kgm/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: NPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Surface tension, newton per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Nm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Moment of force, newton metres.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Oe
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic field in oersteds, (1 Oe = (103/4p) A/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Pa
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure in pascals (N/m). Note: the absolute or relative measurement of pressure is implied with this entry. See below for more explicit forms.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PaPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure change rate in pascals per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Pas
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dynamic viscosity, pascal seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Q
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Quantity power, Q.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Qh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Quantity energy, Qh.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: S
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conductance in siemens.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: SPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Conductance per length (F/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Sv
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dose equivalent in sieverts (J/kg).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: T
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux density in teslas (Wb/m2).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: V
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric potential in volts (W/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: V2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt squared (W/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: V2h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt-squared hour, volt-squared-hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Apparent power in volt amperes. See also real power and reactive power.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VAh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Apparent energy in volt ampere hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VAr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive power in volt amperes reactive. The reactive or imaginary component of electrical power (VIsin(phi)). (See also real power and apparent power). Note: Different meter designs use different methods to arrive at their results. Some meters may compute reactive power as an arithmetic value, while others compute the value vectorially. The data consumer should determine the method in use and the suitability of the measurement for the intended purpose.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VArh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reactive energy in volt ampere reactive hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerHz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux in volt per hertz.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerV
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage, ratio of voltages. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mV/V.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerVA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor, PF, the ratio of the active power to the apparent power. Note: The sign convention used for power factor will differ between IEC meters and EEI (ANSI) meters. It is assumed that the data consumers understand the type of meter being used and agree on the sign convention in use at any given utility.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerVAr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor, PF, the ratio of the active power to the apparent power. Note: The sign convention used for power factor will differ between IEC meters and EEI (ANSI) meters. It is assumed that the data consumers understand the type of meter being used and agree on the sign convention in use at any given utility.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric field strength, volts per metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Vh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt-hour, Volt hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Vs
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volt seconds (Ws/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: W
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Real power in watts (J/s). Electrical power may have real and reactive components. The real portion of electrical power (I²R or VIcos(phi)), is expressed in Watts. See also apparent power and reactive power.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerA
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Active power per current flow, watts per Ampere.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerW
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Signal Strength, ratio of power. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as m to show rates such as mW/W.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Heat flux density, irradiance, watts per square metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPerm2sr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Radiance, watts per square metre steradian.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPermK
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Thermal conductivity in watt/metres kelvin.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Ramp rate in watts per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WPersr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Radiant intensity, watts per steradian.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wb
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Magnetic flux in webers (Vs).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Real energy in watt hours.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: anglemin
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle, minutes.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: anglesec
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle, seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bar
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure in bars, (1 bar = 100 kPa).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: cd
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Luminous intensity in candelas.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: charPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Data rate (baud) in characters per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: character
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number of characters.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: cosPhi
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power factor, dimensionless. Note 1: This definition of power factor only holds for balanced systems. See the alternative definition under code 153. Note 2: Beware of differing sign conventions in use between the IEC and EEI. It is assumed that the data consumer understands the type of meter in use and the sign convention in use by the utility.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: count
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amount of substance, Counter value.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: d
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in days, day = 24 h = 86400 s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dB
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sound pressure level in decibels. Note: multiplier d is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dBm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Power level (logarithmic ratio of signal strength , Bel-mW), normalized to 1mW. Note: multiplier d is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: deg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle in degrees.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: degC
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Relative temperature in degrees Celsius. In the SI unit system the symbol is C. Electric charge is measured in coulomb that has the unit symbol C. To distinguish degree Celsius from coulomb the symbol used in the UML is degC. The reason for not using C is that the special character is difficult to manage in software.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ft3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume, cubic feet.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gPerg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, The ratio of the mass of a solute divided by the mass of the solution. Note: Users may need use a prefix such a to express a quantity such as g/g.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: gal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume in gallons, US gallon (1 gal = 231 in3 = 128 fl ounce).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: h
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in hours, hour = 60 min = 3600 s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ha
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Area, hectares.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kat
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Catalytic activity, katal = mol / s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: katPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Catalytic activity concentration, katals per cubic metre.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mass in kilograms. Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgPerJ
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Weight per energy in kilograms per joule (kg/J). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Density in kilogram/cubic metres (kg/m). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Moment of mass in kilogram metres (kgm) (first moment of mass). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kgm2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Moment of mass in kilogram square metres (kgm) (Second moment of mass, commonly called the moment of inertia). Note: multiplier k is included in this unit symbol for compatibility with IEC 61850-7-3.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: kn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Speed, knots (1 kn = 1852/3600) m/s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: l
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume in litres, litre = dm3 = m3/1000.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lPerh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate, litres per hour.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lPerl
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, The ratio of the volume of a solute divided by the volume of the solution. Note: Users may need use a prefix such a to express a quantity such as L/L.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate in litres per second.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Luminous flux in lumens (cdsr).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: lx
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Illuminance in lux (lm/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Length in metres.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Area in square metres (m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m2Pers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Viscosity in square metres / second (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume in cubic metres (m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Compensated
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume, cubic metres, with the value compensated for weather effects.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Perh
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate, cubic metres per hour.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Perkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Specific volume, cubic metres per kilogram, v.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Pers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volumetric flow rate in cubic metres per second (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: m3Uncompensated
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Volume, cubic metres, with the value uncompensated for weather effects.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Fuel efficiency in metres per cubic metres (m/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Velocity in metres per second (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mPers2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Acceleration in metres per second squared (m/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: min
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in minutes, minute = 60 s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mmHg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pressure, millimetres of mercury (1 mmHg is approximately 133.3 Pa).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: mol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amount of substance in moles.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: molPerkg
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, Molality, the amount of solute in moles and the amount of solvent in kilograms.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: molPerm3
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, The amount of substance concentration, (c), the amount of solvent in moles divided by the volume of solution in m.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: molPermol
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration, Molar fraction, the ratio of the molar amount of a solute divided by the molar amount of the solution.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: none
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Dimension less quantity, e.g. count, per unit, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ohm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric resistance in ohms (V/A).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ohmPerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electric resistance per length in ohms per metre ((V/A)/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ohmm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Resistivity, ohm metres, (rho).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: onePerHz
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Reciprocal of frequency (1/Hz).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: onePerm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wavenumber, reciprocal metres, (1/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ppm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Concentration in parts per million.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rad
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Plane angle in radians (m/m).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: radPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Angular velocity in radians per second (rad/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: radPers2
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Angular acceleration, radians per second squared.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rev
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Amount of rotation, revolutions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rotPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Rotations per second (1/s). See also Hz (1/s).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: s
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time in seconds.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sPers
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Time, Ratio of time. Note: Users may need to supply a prefix such as µ to show rates such as µs/s.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sr
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Solid angle in steradians (m2/m2).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: therm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Energy, therms.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: tonne
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mass in tons, tonne or metric ton (1000 kg = 1 Mg).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Voltage
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Electrical voltage, can be both AC and DC.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltageControlZone
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An area of the power system network which is defined for secondary voltage control purposes. A voltage control zone consists of a collection of substations with a designated bus bar section whose voltage will be controlled.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: BusbarSection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A VoltageControlZone is controlled by a designated BusbarSection.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: RegulationSchedule
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A VoltageControlZone may have a voltage regulation schedule.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: VoltagePerReactivePower
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Voltage variation with reactive power.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WindingConnection
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Winding connection type.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: A
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Autotransformer common winding.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: D
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Delta.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: I
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Independent winding, for single-phase connections.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Y
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wye.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Yn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Wye, with neutral brought out for grounding.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Z
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: ZigZag.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Zn
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: ZigZag, with neutral brought out for grounding.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WireSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A two terminal and power conducting device of negligible impedance and length represented as zero impedance device that can be used to connect auxiliary equipment to its terminals.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WireSegmentPhases
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The wire segment phases which belong to the wire segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WireSegmentPhase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Represents a single wire of an alternating current wire segment.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: WireSegment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The wire segment to which the phase belongs.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: phase
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The phase connection of the wire at both ends.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sequenceNumber
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Number designation for this wire segment phase. Each wire segment phase within a wire segment should have a unique sequence number.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Base
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Content of the base CIM published as IEC 61970-301.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Wires
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An extension to the Core and Topology package that models information on the electrical characteristics of Transmission and Distribution networks. This package is used by network applications such as State Estimation, Load Flow and Optimal Power Flow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: IEC61970
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Top package for IEC 61970.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Core
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contains the core PowerSystemResource and ConductingEquipment entities shared by all applications plus common collections of those entities. Not all applications require all the Core entities. This package does not depend on any other package except the Domain package, but most of the other packages have associations and generalizations that depend on it.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: TC57CIM
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Top package for IEC TC57 CIM.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: LoadModel
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
This package is responsible for modelling the energy consumers and the system load as curves and associated curve data. Special circumstances that may affect the load, such as seasons and day types, are also included here.
This information is used by Load Forecasting and Load Management.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Domain
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The domain package defines primitive datatypes that are used by classes in other packages. Stereotypes are used to describe the datatypes. The following stereotypes are defined: <<enumeration>> A list of permissible constant values. <<Primitive>> The most basic data types used to compose all other data types. <<CIMDatatype>> A datatype that contains a value attribute, an optional unit of measure and a unit multiplier. The unit and multiplier may be specified as a static variable initialized to the allowed value. <<Compound>> A composite of Primitive, enumeration, CIMDatatype or other Compound classes, as long as the Compound classes do not recurse. For all datatypes both positive and negative values are allowed unless stated otherwise for a particular datatype.
